post.body:
Hello everybody. I try to start Zeronet with Tor but I have a problem:

TorManager Disabling Tor, because error while accessing Tor proxy at port 127.0.0.1:9050: Error ([Errno 13] Permission denied: '/var/run/tor/control.authcookie')

I use Ubuntu 19.10.
I followed the Howto in the Zeronet docs and added my login name to the debian-tor group. 
$ sudo usermod -a -G tor myname
In torrc I wrote these lines:
ControlPort 9051
CookieAuthentication 1
DataDirectoryGroupReadable 1
CookieAuthFileGroupReadable 1
ExtORPortCookieAuthFileGroupReadable 1
CacheDirectoryGroupReadable 1
CookieAuthFile /var/run/tor/control.authcookie

After a new login I started tor and Zeronet. "Permission denied".
When I changed the authcookie to chmod 777 and restart tor then the permission are overwritten from tor.
Who can help me to run Zeronet with tor?

Actually I run:
$ zeronet --tor disable --proxy 127.0.0.1:9050 --disable_udp
But I would like to run it in a normal way.
